poem:
### Interfering Do-gooders

In the woven tapestry of rail and road,
children trace lines—
solitary, bold.

Hands unseen tug at loose threads,
questions stitched in fabric's fold
of care and worry.

Whispers tattoo the pressing air,
journey far, child,
under watchful shadows.

The map's embrace is wide,
yet, someone must guard the fringes
of the wanderer's path.
